text: Bilhassa da Kayı ve Çavdar Obalarına saldıracaklardır beyim.
english: especially attack the Kayı and Çavdar tribes, my lord .

text: Türk obaları içinde en güçlü oba Kayı ve Çavdar Obalarıdır.
english: Among the Turkish tribes, the strongest are the Kayı and Çavdar tribes. If

text: Biz düşersek bütün Türk obalarının başı düşer.
english: we fall, the leaders of all Turkish tribes will fall. This is

text: İşte tam da bu sebeple iki obanın birleşmesini uygun görürüm.
english: precisely why I believe the two tribes should unite.
Good morning my baby. My lord, the Rye people are numerous…
…but they are more vulnerable to attack.

text: Hem Çavdarların olduğu yerdeki otlaklar iki obanın sürülerine yetmez beyim.
english: The pastures where the rye fields are located are not enough for the herds of two tribes, my lord.
But the Kayı tribe is in a secure location…

text: …hem de civarındaki otlaklar daha geniştir beyim.
english: …and the surrounding pastures are much larger, my lord.

text: Bakıyorum bu işe en çok sen sevindin Bamsı.
english: I see you're the happiest about this, Bamsı.

text: Tabii beyim. Sevinmez miyim? Allah’ın izniyle birlikte olacağız.
english: Of course, sir. Wouldn't I be happy? With God's permission, we will be together.

text: Çavdar Obasının, Kayı Obasına yerleşmesi en münasibi olur.
english: would be most appropriate for the Çavdar tribe to settle in the Kayı tribe's territory. When I

text: Ben de obaya dönünce ahaliye meseleyi anlatır…
english: return to the camp, I will explain the matter to the villagers… and
begin preparations for the migration. -Thanks, Turgut.

text: Artuk Bey, sen de Alpleri vazifelendir.
english: Artuk Bey, you too should assign duties to the Alps.

text: Kayı Obasında, Çavdarlar için yer tespit etsinler.
english: In the Kayı tribe, let them locate a place for the Çavdar family.
The order is yours, sir. Let's not keep

text: Hadi o vakit, Ares’i de, ahaliyi de idam için çok bekletmeyelim.
english: Ares or the people waiting any longer for their executions.
Sir, Ares wishes to speak with you.
Let's see if the devil's tongue has been loosened.

text: Savaşta kazanmak da var, kaybetmek de.
english: In war, there is winning and there is losing.
Let's pray that he's alive. Let's have some hope

text: Onu kurtarmak için bir umudumuz olsun.
…bu savaşı imparatorluğumuz adına sen yürüteceksin Titan.
english: …you will wage this war for our empire, Titan. Don't become a prisoner of your

text: Ares gibi, Ertuğrul’a olan öfkenin esiri olup da…
english: anger towards Ertuğrul, like Ares... and

text: Sultan, Karacahisar’ı verdiği gibi Söğüt ve Domaniç’i de Ertuğrul’a vermiş.
english: Sultan gave Ertuğrul Karacahisar, as well as Söğüt and Domaniç.
We can't leave those places to Ertuğrul.

text: Yarın Bilecik ve Nikea’yı da alırlar.
english: tomorrow they will also take Bilegcik and Nicaea.
He took her to the castle. He threw him in jail. He was going to
-Who is this man? -Not a man, a woman.

text: Kalede ne olup bittiğini ondan öğreneceksin.
english: You'll find out what happened at the castle from him.

text: Tuzak kurup benden aldığın bu pusat birazdan kelleni biçecek Ares.
english: This weapon you took from me by setting a trap will soon cut off your head, Ares.
whatever you have to say then.
In exchange for you stopping the execution…
I will tell Sultan Aladdin everything.

text: Kara zindanda ölüm korkusu, aklını başına getirmiş demek.
english: The fear of death in that dark dungeon must have brought him to his senses. I cannot sacrifice my life,

text: Ne senin devletin için ne de Emir Sadeddin gibi birisi için…
english: neither for your state nor for someone like Emir Sadeddin
him and throw him back in the dungeon.
If Titan finds out we took Ares to Konya…
Tomorrow we will get Ares out through the secret passage .
We'll travel to Konya via routes that...
...no one could ever imagine. It's not
He will understand why I took Ares to Konya. At

text: O vakit Ares’i sultanın huzuruna çıkarmamam için…

english: he will do whatever it takes to prevent me from bringing Ares before the sultan.
The threat within the palace has now been eliminated.

text: Ama içimi kemiren bir mesele daha var.
english: But there's another issue that's been bothering me.
What is the matter, my sultan? The
My fear is for my country. Just

text: Moğollar doğuyu ele geçirdikleri gibi güneyimizi de ele geçirip…
english: as the Mongols conquered the east, they also want to conquer our south…
…to surround us and swallow us up.

text: İslam devletlerini de avuçlarının içine alacaklar.
english: They will also bring the Islamic states under their control.
They wait for our weakest moment. They will set their sights
on my country at the first opportunity . May

text: Allah sizi başımızdan eksik etmesin sultanım.
english: God never take you away from us, my Sultan.
I will die sooner or later, Sadeddin.

text: Lakin ölümüm beklenmedik bir anda tecelli ederse...
english: But what if my death comes unexpectedly ...

text: Bu yüzden tahta kimin geçeceğine tez karar vermeliyim.
english: Therefore, I must quickly decide who will ascend to the throne. Is

text: Hayır. Küçük oğlum Kılıç Arslan’ın yerime tahta geçmesini isterim.
english: No. I would like my youngest son, Kılıç Arslan, to succeed me on the throne.
Why would you want this? If

text: Eyyubi melikesi eşimden olan oğlum Kılıç Arslan sultan olursa…
english: my son Kilij Arslan, from my wife the Ayyubid queen, becomes sultan…

text: …İslam âleminin Moğollara karşı kenetlenmesine vesile olacaktır.
english: …it will be an opportunity for the Islamic world to unite against the Mongols .

text: Ertuğrul’la bu meselenin ne ilgisi var sultanım?
english: Ertuğrul have to do with this matter, my sultan? I know that the Turkish tribes
under the command of Ertuğrul Bey
will open the gates of Bilecik... and even Nicaea... through holy war.

text: Ben öldükten sonra dahi fethettiği toprakların ihyasından…
english: Even after my death, I want him to remain prosperous and responsible for the revitalization of the lands he conquered

text: Bu yüzden devletim gibi onu da kaderine terk edemem.
english: That's why I can't abandon him to his fate, just like I can't abandon my country.
Therefore, I will issue a decree.

text: Dahası, devletimin kıymetli bir komutanını ve birliğini…
english: Furthermore, I will place a valuable commander and unit of my state under
…the perfect fit for this task, my sultan.
He was in Ahlat on your orders. Then

text: O vakit haber et, Ertuğrul Bey geldiğinde...
english: inform him, when Ertuğrul Bey arrives...
...that he too should come to my palace. I will place

text: Onu ve birliğindeki askerleri Ertuğrul Bey’in emrine…
english: him and the soldiers in his unit under the command of Ertuğrul Bey… …and entrust them with
You have thought very wisely, my sultan.
I will declare my heir upon my return from the journey.
As you see fit, my sultan.
Bamsi, choose a troop of Alps. They should set

text: Bizden önce yola çıkıp güzergâhı iyice tetkik etsinler.
english: off before us and thoroughly examine the route.

text: Herhangi bir tehlikeyle karşılaşırlarsa bize önceden haber etsinler.
english: They should inform us in advance if they encounter any danger.
The order is yours, sir. While

text: Biz Konya’dayken Çavdar Obası'nın göçünü sen tertip edesin Turgut.
english: we are in Konya, you organize the migration of the Çavdar tribe, Turgut.

text: Halime Hatun da benimle birlikte Konya’ya gelecek.
english: Halime Hatun will also come to Konya with me. It

text: Yanımda olması münasip olur. Biz dönene dek…
english: would be appropriate for him to be with me. Until we return…

text: …kale ve Hanlı Pazar da Artuk Bey’e emanettir.
english: …and the castle and Hanlı Bazaar to Artuk Bey.
You summoned me, Your Highness. Deliver

text: Bu mektubu tez Ahlat’ta bulunan Komutan Yakup Bey’e ulaştırasın Göktuğ.
english: this letter quickly to Commander Yakup Bey in Ahlat, Göktuğ. When will
Prince Gıyasettin and his mother Mahperi Hatun arrive
from Alâiye? I learned, sir, that they set out towards Konya to see the

text: Sultan sefere gitmeden evvel onu uğurlamak maksadıyla…
english: Sultan off before he departed on his campaign

text: O da Şehzade Gıyasettin ve anasıyla birlikte yoldadır.
english: He is also on the road with Prince Gıyasettin and his mother.

text: Bakalım sultanın teamülleri elinin tersiyle itip…
english: Let's see what they will do when they learn that the sultan has disregarded tradition and will make his

text: …küçük oğlu Kılıç Arslan’ı kendine varis yapacağını öğrendiklerinde…
english: youngest son, Kılıç Arslan, his heir.

text: Neticede istediğinizin olacağından şüphem yoktur Emir Hazretleri.
english: Ultimately, I have no doubt that you will get what you want, Your Highness.
Go ahead and deliver the thesis letter to Ahlat.

text: Yakup Bey, Karacahisar’da Ertuğrul’un başına saracağım en büyük bela olacak.
english: Yakup Bey will be the biggest problem I'll bring upon Ertuğrul in Karacahisar.
I know the fire burning inside you, son.

text: Sen devletinin selameti için nefsini dizginlersin.
english: You restrain your ego for the sake of your country's safety .
You would be right to do so.
God will surely help you. Do

text: Sen beni merak etmeyesin ana. Kendini yormayasın.
english: n't worry about me, Mom. Don't tire yourself out.

text: Ben burada yokken bir ihtiyacın olursa…
english: If you need anything while I'm away…
Mr. Artuk is always here. Don't let

text: Senin aklın, yüreğin burada kalmasın oğul.
english: your mind and heart stay here, son.
I'm doing very well. I will wait for
his older brothers to arrive at the castle .

text: Belli mi olur, bakarsın ağabeylerim benden önce varırlar kaleye.
english: , maybe my older brothers will get to the castle before me.
...if I leave and there's no return...

text: Hakkım da, sütüm de sana helal olsun oğul.
english: My rights and the milk I gave you are all yours, my son.

text: Baba, ben de sizinle gelsem olmaz mı?
english: Dad, can I come with you ? Is that

text: Bu koskoca kaleyi kim koruyacak sonra?
english: Who will protect this huge castle then?

text: Bamsı Alp var, Turgut Alp var, daha bir sürü Alp var.
english: There's Bamsı Alp, there's Turgut Alp, and many more Alps.

text: Onlar hepsi Alp'tir, sen Alpbaşısın oğul.
english: They are all Alps, and you are the Alpbaşı (chief Alp), son.

text: O Alplerin başında bir tane bey oğlunun durması gerekir.
english: A nobleman's son should stand guard at the head of those Alps.

text: Biz ananla yola revan olunca kaleyi sen koruyacaksın.
english: You will guard the fortress when your mother and I leave.
The order is yours, sir. Well

text: (Ares iç ses) Umarım bir an önce yetişip beni kurtarırsın dostum Titan.
english: (Ares' inner voice) I hope you arrive and rescue me soon, my friend Titan.
(Ares' inner voice) You are my only hope.
Goodbye, mother. Have a safe trip,

text: Güle güle gidin oğlum. Allah’a emanet olun.
english: my son. May God protect you.

text: Evvelden giderken yalnızca obamız ve otağımız sana emanetti Gündüz’üm.
english: In the past, when we left, only our village and our tent were entrusted to you, Gündüz.

text: Bundan gayrı bu kale sana emanettir.
english: From now on, this fortress is entrusted to your care.

text: Döndüğümde tek tek malumat isterim, haberin olsun.
english: I'll ask for detailed information when I get back, just so you know. Do
Wow, my brave young man! -May God protect you

text: -Allah’a emanet olasınız. -Sizler de Artuk Bey. Eyvallah.
Gardaşın Savcı sana emanettir. Ona iyi bakasın e mi oğul.
english: Your brother, the prosecutor, is entrusted to your care. Take good care of her, okay son?

text: (Gündüz) Sen de tez gidip dönesin e mi ana.
english: (Daytime) You should go and come back soon, Mom .
My brother and I will wait for you.
Are the other Alps ready, Abdurrahman?

text: Alplerimiz hazırdır beyim. Gizli geçidin çıkışında beklerler.
english: Our Alps are ready, sir. They wait at the exit of the secret passage.
Good morning my baby. Let's go then. Let

text: Su gibi gidin, su gibi gelin inşallah.
english: you go like water, and return like water, God willing.

text: (Ares iç ses) Ertuğrul’u yenmek için açtığım geçitten…
english: (Ares' inner voice) It seems that the passage I opened to defeat Ertuğrul...
...also meant to lead to me being taken as his prisoner .
This compass came from our spy in the fort.
Ertuğrul was going to take Ares to Konya. Ares was spared in exchange for

text: Bildiklerini sultana anlatma karşılığında canını kurtarmış Ares.
english: telling the sultan what he knew .

text: Casusumuz bizzat Ertuğrul’un sağ kolu Artuk Bey’in ağzından işitmiş bunu.
english: Our spy heard this directly from Artuk Bey, Ertuğrul's right-hand man.
…must surely be hoping that we will rescue him .
We must rescue Ares before we reach Konya.

text: Ertuğrul, Ares’i Konya’ya götürürken tüm tedbirleri alacaktır.
english: Ertuğrul will take all necessary precautions while transporting Ares to Konya.
He will take her along remote roads.
We'll never find his trail. Do

text: …Ertuğrul konuşması karşılığında Ares’i mutlaka serbest bırakacaktır.
english: ...Ertuğrul will definitely release Ares in exchange for his words . What
we should be thinking about now is… …

text: …Ertuğrul’u nasıl bitireceğimiz ve Türkleri nasıl durduracağımız olmalı.
english: how to finish off Ertuğrul and how to stop the Turks.
… we will intensify our attacks in his absence.
But I will do this not with peasant soldiers…

text: Ares, Ertuğrul’un elinden kurtulduğunda bizi mutlaka bulacaktır.
english: Ares will surely find us when he escapes from Ertuğrul's clutches .

text: Şimdi söyle bana, bu kadar bilgiyi kimden alıyorsun?
english: Now tell me, where are you getting all this information from?
Who is the female spy in the castle?

text: Konya’ya varana değin Ares’in dibinden ayrılmayasınız, anlaşıldı mı?
english: Ares's side until you reach Konya , understood?

text: Ben sıradan bir tutsak değilim, Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I am not an ordinary prisoner, Ertuğrul Bey.

text: Tekfurum. Umarım Konya yolunda da bunu unutmazsın.
english: Tekfur. I hope you won't forget this on your way to Konya.
Tie their hands and feet tightly. If

text: Yol boyunca konuşursa ağzını da bağlarsınız.
english: he talks during the journey, you'll tie his mouth shut.
